page.title: 10A CHADDESLEY MARKET GARDEN
page.content: Chaddesley Growers in Chaddesley Corbett is the largest Market Garden in the area. The land was separated off from Lodge Farm 20 years ago when 4.9 hectares began to be used for the production of tomatoes and soft fruit. Chaddesley Brook provided water for irrigation and today this is supplied from a bore hole and piped into the ground where the soft fruit trees and bushes grow."Pick your own" crops have been grown since 1977 when strawberries raspberries and gooseberries were and still are the most popular. Conifers are grown for direct sale to Nurseries and Garden centres. Tomatoes, courgettes and lettuces are grown in hot houses for sale at the local market. The business is run by 3 people with some pickers taken on in the summer. The rest of the fruit is picked by the public.
